questions.question: How many degrees are in the exterior angle of a regular octagon?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
The exterior angles of all polygons have a sum of 360 degrees and since an octagon has 8 sides, we will just divide 360 by 8.
360/8= 45 degrees
Therefore, the measure of each interior angle of a regular octagon is 45 degrees.

questions.question: What is the measure of each interior angle of a regular pentagon?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: (n-2)180/n Pentagons have 5 sides so n=5, (5-2)180/5 = (3)180/5 = 540/5=108. Therefore, the answer is 108 degrees.

questions.question: What is the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation: (n-2)180 since a quadrilateral has 4 sides then n=4, (4-2)180=> (2)180=360, therefore the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral is 360 degrees.

questions.question: If a regular polygon has interior angles measuring 150 degrees, how many sides does it have?
questions.correctAnswerExplanation:
In finding the measure of each interior angle, we will use the formula (n-2)180/n
(n-2)180/n= 150 we will just have to cross multiply
=>(n-2)180= 150n distribute 180 to (n-2)
=> 180n-360= 150n, combine like terms
=> 180n-150n=360
=> 30n=360, divide both sides by 30
=> so n=12, therefore if the measure of an interior angle is 150 then it has 12 sides.
